comments.body: I know most of tests in FsHistoryProviderSuite don't deal with rolling event log, but this should really deal with it, as it's not just simple sequential reading of files.

I think it should really check whether store reflects the events correctly. It's not enough to just check it's loaded or not. That should cover these cases - initial read / new addition of events in same file / new file.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +221,225 @@      provider.getAttempt("app1", None).logPath should endWith(EventLogFileWriter.IN_PROGRESS)
      val appUi = provider.getAppUI("app1", None)
      appUi should not be null
    }

comments.body:
No need to use `.key` here.

(I'll fix this during merge.)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1324,1328 @@  test("SPARK-29043: clean up specified event log") {
    val clock = new ManualClock()
    val conf = createTestConf().set(MAX_LOG_AGE_S.key, "0").set(CLEANER_ENABLED.key, "true")
    val provider = new FsHistoryProvider(conf, clock)

comments.body: Previously, this was always 1 because the newly released `accessDeniedPath` is ignored by `shouldReloadLog` due to the unchanged size.
shall we add a comment in order to explain this? Can we also check that accessDeniedPath is present in the list? Thanks!

Sure, I updated like the following. So, it explains itself without comments.
```
+      list.exists(_.name == "accessDenied")
+      list.exists(_.name == "accessGranted")
+      list.size should be(2)
```
